p.k: Marvin Gaye: The Real Thing Marvin Gaye. 2005
p.d: Marvin Gaye – The Real Thing In Performance 1964 – 1981 begins with Marvin singing one of his earliest hits, 'Hitch Hike,' on American Bandstand in 1964. The program progresses through the artist's entire Motown career, including vintage performances of 'Pride & Joy,' 'Ain't That Peculiar,' 'Can I Get A Witness,' 'Let's Get It On' and a host of others. Further treasures include a beautiful 1967 duet performance of 'Ain't No Mountain High Enough' with Tammi Terrell; a staggering live concert performance of 'What's Going On' and 'What's Happening Brother' from 1972; and an amazing live 1969 performance of 'I Heard It Through The Grapevine' from the American TV show Hollywood Palace recorded while the song was still No. 1 on the U.S. charts. Interspersed between the songs, Marvin talks about his life and music in interview segments from various TV shows throughout his career.
